isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - Before 12/06/1994 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - EVAPORATOR CORE

step1.para: Discharge the air conditioning system. Refer to GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Remove the cover from the passenger side of the instrument panel.
Remove the cover from the heater/evaporator unit.
Remove the dash panel seal retainers and seals surrounding the evaporator unit inlet and outlet tubes ( Figure 22).
Disconnect inlet and outlet hoses from the evaporator unit tubes ( Figure 22). Plug or cap inlet and outlet hoses.
Disconnect low pressure switch from the wiring harness.
Remove bolt and nut from clamp securing expansion valve to bracket on the blower housing.
Remove air filter seal mounting strip and air filter from blower housing as described in this section under AIR FILTER.

Remove heater core mounting screws. (DO NOT disconnect hoses from the heater core.) Pull heater core outward to disengage mounting slot. Move heater core down and to the right (passenger side). (This will permit access to the front evaporator core mounting screws and permit withdrawal of the thermostatic temperature control switch capillary tube from the evaporator core.)
Withdraw the thermostatic control switch capillary tube from the evaporator core.
Remove the evaporator core mounting screws ( Figure 23).
Remove the evaporator core from the unit housing ( Figure 24).
Remove the low pressure switch and expansion valve from the evaporator. Refer to previous instructions in this Service Manual section.
Install the expansion valve and the low pressure switch on the evaporator core as described in this section.
Position the evaporator core in the unit housing. If damaged, replace the seal surrounding the evaporator inlet and outlet pipes in bottom of the unit.
Install the evaporator core mounting screws.
Position the thermostatic temperature control switch capillary tube in the evaporator as described in this section.
Install the heater core as described in this section.
Install the air filter and seal mounting strip on the blower housing.
Install the clamp, bolt and nut to secure the expansion valve to the bracket on the blower housing.
Connect the low pressure switch wires to the wiring harness.

Install new O-rings. Lubricate the threads with mineral-based refrigerant oil and connect the inlet and outlet hoses to the evaporator unit inlet and outlet tubes. Tighten as specified in the TORQUE CHART.
Install the dash panel seals and retainers surrounding the evaporator inlet and outlet tubes.
Evacuate and charge the Air Conditioning system. Refer to GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Check the A/C system operation.
Replace the Blend-Air and instrument panel covers.
